The specimens will be send to the below Institution in Germany for analysis: Focus Group Marine Molecular Ecology, Helmholtz Institute for Functional Marine Biodiversity at the University of Oldenburg (HIFMB) and Alfred Wegener Institute Helmholtz Center for Polar and Marine Research Academic or research institute Ammerländer Heerstraße 231 26129 Oldenburg, Germany Phone: +4947148312566 Email: silke.laakmann@hifmb.de
This is to perform whole-genome sequencing on the extracted DNA from the worms for academic research relating to epidemiology and disease control.
The project complies with the ABS prior inform consent and mutually agreed term in the light of Nagoya Protocol and its purpose is for research purpose only

This is a prospective observational study which there is no treatment given to patients according to study procedures. Only medical intervention for this study is sample collection that is totally independent of the treatment and all patients involving in the study will receive standard care for P. falciparum and/or P. vivax malaria as well as drug therapy according to the national treatment guidelines of their countries.

This is a prospective observational study which there is no treatment given to patients according to study procedures. Only medical intervention for this study is sample collection that is totally independent of the treatment and all patients involving in the study will receive standard care for P. falciparum and/or P. vivax malaria as well as drug therapy according to the national treatment guidelines of their countries.

The main activity of this project is to protect wildlife and other biological resources in the NT2 Watershed with particular emphasis on endangered Annamite endemic species for ensuring their long-term well-being and continued viability through effective and proactive law enforcement. In this regard, samples of fecal samples from otter species (Eurasian otter Lutra lutra, Smooth-coated Otter Lutrogale perspicillata , Asian Small-clawed Otter Aonyx cinereus ) will be collected in the wild in Nakai-Nam Theun National Park from November 2019 to April 2020. The samples will be then sent to Conservation Ecology Program, King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi in Thailand in order to conduct DNA extraction in the laboratory. This permission is hereby issued as the evidence of the utilization of genetic resources for research purposes only, which is not valid after 31 December 2023. The Association Project Anoulak, as a user, must submit a copy of the sample information with the permission of the local partner, MAF, to the ABS authority in order to register each export till ending project, and must share the research results and publications (all partners must be included as co-authors in the resulting publications) with the local partner and ABS authority in order to acknowledge the provider of genetic resources. If further experiment of the genetic resources is used for commercial purposes, the user then needs to inform the authority and the ABS agreement must to be established among the user and provider.

Academic research related to surface water and groundwater quantity and quality, soil erosion, biogeochemistry.

Collection and genotyping of Asian elephant dung samples on the Nakai Plateau region of Lao PDR to estimate the current minimum population size and level of genetic diversity for comparison with the previous study of the population prior to construction of the NT2 dam on the Nam Theun River.
Academic research related to surface water and groundwater quantity and quality, soil erosion, biogeochemistry.

The purpose is to investigate the manifold values related to different types of seeds including ethical, ecological, use, or exchange values
The genetic resource or the sample will be exported from Lao PDR to Institut de recherche pour le développement (IRD)-French National Research Institute for Sustainable Development, France.

This is a prospective observational study in which there is no treatment given to patients according to study procedures. The only medical intervention for this study is sample collection that is totally independent of the treatment and all patients involved in the study will receive standard care for P. falciparum and/or P. vivax malaria as well as drug therapy according to the national treatment guidelines of their countries.
